item.title: Investigating A VIX Trading Signal
item.description:
Post Updates

Update 4/8/2025: Added plot for signals for each year. VIX data through 4/7/25.
Update 4/9/2025: VIX data through 4/8/25.
Update 4/12/2025: VIX data through 4/10/25.
Update 4/22/2025: VIX data through 4/18/25.
Update 4/23/2025: VIX data through 4/22/25.

item.title: Does Harry Browne's permanent portfolio withstand the test of time?
item.description:
Post Updates

Update 12/5/2024: Updated code for summary stats function, various code comments, and corrected grammatical errors.
Update 2/19/2025: Various code updates, commented and documented functions.
Update 5/2/2025: Updated functions and code.

Introduction

Harry Browne was an influencial politician, financial advisor, and author who lived from 1933 to 2006 and published 12 books. Wikipedia has an in-depth biography on him.

Within the world of finance and investing, one of his best known works is Fail-Safe Investing: Lifelong Financial Security in 30 Minutes. In it, he introduces the idea of the “Permanent Portfolio”, an investment strategy that uses only four assets and is very simple to implement.

item.title: Nasdaq Data Link Tables API Data Retrieval
item.description:
Introduction

In this tutorial, we will write a python function that pulls data from Nasdaq Data Link through the tables API, adds relevant columns that are not present in the raw data, updates columns to allow for ease of use, and leaves the data in a format where it can then be used in time series analysis.

Nasdaq Data Link is a provider of numerous different types of financial data from many different asset classes. It provides API’s that allow access from Python, R, Excel, and other methods. It is available to institutional investors as well as individual retail investors.

item.title: Cleaning A Bloomberg Data Excel Export
item.description:
Introduction

In this tutorial, we will write a python function that imports an excel export from Bloomberg, removes ancillary rows and columns, and leaves the data in a format where it can then be used in time series analysis.

Example of a Bloomberg excel export

We will use the SPX index data in this example. Exporting the data from Bloomberg using the excel Bloomberg add-on yields data in the following format:
